myths.myth: Cracking your knuckles causes arthritis
myths.truth: There is no evidence that cracking your knuckles causes arthritis. The sound comes from gas bubbles in the joint fluid.

myths.myth: Goldfish have a 3-second memory
myths.truth: Goldfish can actually remember things for months, not just a few seconds.

myths.myth: Bats are blind
myths.truth: Bats are not blind. They can see, and many species have very good eyesight.

myths.myth: Humans only use 10% of their brains
myths.truth: Neuroscience shows that humans use all parts of their brain, even when at rest.

myths.myth: Eating carrots improves night vision
myths.truth: Carrots are healthy and contain Vitamin A, which supports vision, but they do not give superhuman night vision.

myths.myth: Shaving hair makes it grow back thicker
myths.truth: Shaving does not change hair thickness. It only makes the tip blunt, which can feel coarser.

myths.myth: Lightning never strikes the same place twice
myths.truth: Lightning can strike the same place multiple times, especially tall structures like skyscrapers.

myths.myth: Sugar causes hyperactivity in children
myths.truth: Scientific studies have found no direct link between sugar and hyperactivity in children.

myths.myth: You swallow 8 spiders a year while sleeping
myths.truth: This is a myth. Spiders generally avoid humans and donâ€™t crawl into mouths while we sleep.

myths.myth: The Great Wall of China is visible from space
myths.truth: The Great Wall is not visible to the naked eye from space. Astronauts confirm this.

myths.myth: Chameleons change color to match their surroundings
myths.truth: Chameleons mainly change color due to temperature, mood, and communication, not just camouflage.

myths.myth: You should drink 8 glasses of water a day
myths.truth: Water needs vary by person. Hydration also comes from food and other beverages.

myths.myth: A penny dropped from a skyscraper can kill someone
myths.truth: A penny is too small and light to cause serious harm when dropped from a building.

myths.myth: Humans evolved from chimpanzees
myths.truth: Humans and chimpanzees share a common ancestor but evolved separately.

myths.myth: Vaccines cause autism
myths.truth: Extensive research shows vaccines do not cause autism. This myth is based on a fraudulent study.

myths.myth: If you touch a baby bird, its mother will abandon it
myths.truth: Most birds have a poor sense of smell and will not abandon their chicks if touched by humans.

myths.myth: Ostriches bury their heads in the sand
myths.truth: Ostriches do not bury their heads in the sand. They lower their heads to the ground to look for danger.

myths.myth: Coffee stunts your growth
myths.truth: There is no scientific evidence that coffee affects growth. Genetics and nutrition determine height.

myths.myth: Touching a toad gives you warts
myths.truth: Warts are caused by viruses, not toads. Touching a toad will not give you warts.

myths.myth: You should wait an hour after eating before swimming
myths.truth: There is no medical reason to wait an hour. Swimming after eating is safe for most people.
